official-title.#text: To amend the Longshore and Harbor Workers’ Compensation Act to provide a definition of recreational vessel for purposes of such Act.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives July 29, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Longshore and Harbor Workers’ Compensation Clarification Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Longshore and Harbor Workers’ Compensation Clarification Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 2 of the Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2
Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2/p:22
Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2/p:23
Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2/p:21

text.#text: being manufactured or operated primarily for pleasure; or
leased, rented, or chartered to another for the latter's pleasure.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2/p:22/sp:A

text.#text: A vessel being manufactured or built, or being repaired under warranty by its manufacturer or builder, is a recreational vessel if the vessel appears intended, based on its design and construction, to be for ultimate recreational uses. The manufacturer or builder bears the burden of establishing that a vessel is recreational under this standard.

A vessel being repaired, dismantled for repair, or dismantled at the end of its life will be treated as recreational at the time of repair, dismantling for repair, or dismantling, provided that such vessel shares elements of design and construction of traditional recreational vessels and is not normally engaged in a military, commercial, or traditionally commercial undertaking.

A vessel will be treated as a recreational vessel if it is a public vessel, such as a vessel owned or chartered and operated by the United States, or by a State or political subdivision thereof, at the time of repair, dismantling for repair, or dismantling, provided that such vessel shares elements of design and construction with traditional recreational vessels and is not normally engaged in a military, commercial, or traditionally commercial undertaking.
Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2(22) of the Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act/s:2/p:22
Longshore and Harbor Workers’ Compensation Clarification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

external-xref.#tail: of title 20, Code of Federal Regulations, by deleting the text of subsections (a) and (b) of such section and replacing it with only the text of the definition of recreational vessel in

text.#text: make no further modification to such definition in another regulation or any administrative directive.
